intro: Oxysepala ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaf oxysepala, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, adding to its ornamental value. Its botanical classification places it within the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants. Oxysepala ovalifolium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth.
